info.title: HCL Domino REST API setup
info.description:
REST APIs for Domino and more done right.
With declarative security and access to Code, Design and data
Administrative Portion

/dxl.summary: Actions on DXL of a database.
/dxl.description: Get raw DXL of a given database, upload DXL to alter design elements, or removes DXL from cache.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

parameters.name: nsfPath
parameters.description: Path relative to the notesdata directory of the nsf to access.

20190712T210038,90+08 20220407T151018,23+08 20220407T151018,22+08 20220407T151018,22+08 20190712T210038,94+08 CN=YING FENG/O=HCLPNP 20220407T151018,11+08 %REM Agent SalesforceProcessing Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL Description: Comments for Agent %END REM Option Public Option Declare Sub Initialize Dim s As New NotesSession Dim db As NotesDatabase Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection Dim doc As NotesDocument Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument Set db = s.Currentdatabase Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument() While Not doc Is Nothing Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc) Call handleOneDoc(doc) Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc) Set doc = nextDoc Wend End Sub %REM Sub handleOneDoc Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields %END REM Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument) Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem Dim item As NotesItem Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body") Forall i In doc.Items Set item = i If item.name <> "Body" Then rt.Appendtext(item.Name) rt.Appendtext(": ") rt.Appendtext(item.Text) rt.Addnewline(1) End If End Forall Call doc.save(True,True) End Sub 20190712T213039,48+08 20220407T151018,24+08 20220407T151018,23+08 20220407T151018,23+08 20190712T213039,53+08 CN=YING FENG/O=HCLPNP 20220407T151018,14+08 %REM Agent SalesforceProcessing Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL Description: Comments for Agent %END REM Option Public Option Declare Sub Initialize Dim s As New NotesSession Dim db As NotesDatabase Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection Dim doc As NotesDocument Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument Set db = s.Currentdatabase Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument() While Not doc Is Nothing Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc) Call handleOneDoc(doc) Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc) Set doc = nextDoc Wend End Sub %REM Sub handleOneDoc Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields %END REM Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument) Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem Dim item As NotesItem Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body") Forall i In doc.Items Set item = i If item.name <> "Body" Then rt.Appendtext(item.Name) rt.Appendtext(": ") rt.Appendtext(item.Text) rt.Addnewline(1) End If End Forall Call doc.save(True,True) End Sub 20190910T180253,01+08 20220407T151018,25+08 20220407T151018,24+08 20220407T151018,24+08 /admin/quickconfig.summary: Quick config a nsf database to be available for Domino REST API access
/admin/quickconfig.description: For a nsf database, this endpoint can be used to create a scope and config schema automatically. After configuration, user can access the database through provided scope name directly. No need to manually config schema any more. By default, all visible forms and views will be configured. All configured forms will contain all fields in original forms.

requestBody.description:
In the request body, the following attributes can be specified:
"nsfPath" (required): a nsf database path,
"schemaName" : schema name to be used for the schema name. By default, it is "default"
"scopeName" : scope name used to access the database. If not specified, nsf database file name will be used
"create" : If it is true and the nsf database does not exist, a empty database will be created

post.summary: Create a scope and config schema
post.description: Create a scope and config schema

/admin/scope.summary: Connection of scope (public name) to a defined schema (a.k.a KeepDbConfig) in a NSF
/admin/scope.description:
scope names are unique to a Domino server, while schema definitions are unique only to the nsf they reside in.
This endpoint allows to CRUD on the mappings between scope and schema

parameters.name: scopeName
parameters.description: Scope name of the mapping

get.summary: Retrieves rest configuration from the server
get.description: Maps a schema to a scope

parameters.name: createSchema
parameters.description:
If the database mentioned has no Schema of the given name, create an empty one.
Requires designer access to the target database

parameters.name: scopeName
parameters.description: API Name of the mapping

delete.summary: Delete a rest mapping from the directory
delete.description: Delete a rest mapping from the directory

/admin/scopes.summary: Connection of scope (public name) to a defined schema (a.k.a KeepDbConfig) in a NSF
/admin/scopes.description:
scope names are unique to a Domino domain, while schema definitions are unique only to the nsf they reside in.
This endpoint allows to CRUD on the mappings between scope and schema. It will show active and inactive scopes and is for use of the admin. API consumerss rather use /scope instead of /admin/scope

get.summary: Get all of the rest mappings on the server,
get.description: Return the list of scopes and their details.

Fix Body.Options:
%REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare
Fix Body.handleOneDoc:
%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub
Fix Body.Forward:
Declare Sub Initialize
Declare Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
Fix Body.Initialize:
Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub

SalesforceProcessing.Options:
%REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare
SalesforceProcessing.handleOneDoc:
%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub
SalesforceProcessing.Forward:
Declare Sub Initialize
Declare Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
SalesforceProcessing.Initialize:
Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub

AgentSample.value:
fromSalesforce
            
         %REM
	Agent SalesforceProcessing
	Created Jul 12, 2019 by Stephan Wissel/Singapore/PNPHCL
	Description: Comments for Agent
%END REM
Option Public
Option Declare


Sub Initialize
	Dim s As New NotesSession
	Dim db As NotesDatabase
	Dim dcol As NotesDocumentCollection
	Dim doc As NotesDocument
	Dim nextDoc As NotesDocument
	Set db = s.Currentdatabase
	Set dcol = db.Unprocesseddocuments
	Set doc = dcol.Getfirstdocument()
	While Not doc Is Nothing
		Set nextDoc = dcol.Getnextdocument(doc)
		Call handleOneDoc(doc)
		Call s.Updateprocesseddoc(doc)
		Set doc = nextDoc
	Wend
End Sub



%REM
	Sub handleOneDoc
	Description: Creates a RichTextItem for all Fields
%END REM
Sub handleOneDoc(doc As NotesDocument)
	Dim rt As NotesRichTextItem
	Dim item As NotesItem
	Set rt = doc.Createrichtextitem("Body")
	ForAll i In doc.Items
		Set item = i
		If item.name <> "Body" Then
			rt.Appendtext(item.Name)
			rt.Appendtext(": ")
			rt.Appendtext(item.Text)
			rt.Addnewline(1)
		End If
	End ForAll	

	Call doc.save(True,True)
End Sub

/design/nsf.summary: Create a database, based on a template if required
/design/nsf.description:
Create a database, in the meanwhile configure it known to Domino REST API. 

Default ACL values for the database:
- -default-, Editor
- Anonymous, No Access
- LocalDomainAdmins, Manager
- LocalDomainServers, Manager
- <Local Server Name>, Manager
- OtherDomainServers, No Access
- <Current User>, Manager

requestBody.description:
Just 'nsfPath' and 'title' are requested. 'templateName' is not required.
'nsfPath' should be the path of the database you want to create. 'templateName' should be the path of the template being located.

post.summary: Create a database, based on a template if required
post.description: Create a database, based on the nsfPath and title in the request body, if required you can also configure the template in request body.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Scope name

parameters.name: nsfPath
parameters.description: Alternate access to the design of an NSF to facilitate creation of schema definition, required if dataSource is not specified

/schema.description: Checks for JSON resources following the naming scheme. The json file should be stored in Resources->Files in the database.

parameters.description:
default = true,
When set, schema written to the database design are flagged so the
Domino design task won't replace/delete the schema

delete.summary: Delete a REST configuration (Schema) from the specified database

Path in internet style relative to the Domino data directory.
e.g. "demo.nsf" or "sales/england/crm_gb.nsf"

parameters.name: configName
parameters.description: Schema name you want to retrieve.

/schemas.description: Checks for JSON resources following the naming scheme

AdminBackup.description: Definition of a Domino REST API configuration.

version.description: Basic information about Domino REST API.

databases.description: All database configuration, including keepconfig(KeepConfig.nsf) which has configuration settings for the Domino REST API.

AdminCache.title: Root Type for AdminCache
AdminCache.description: Definition of a Domino REST API cache of design element summaries.

cached.description: If the specified database has been cached, then return true. Otherwise false.

apiName.description: How this database is known to the API.

formcount.description: Form count exsit in the Domino REST API cache folder.

viewcount.description: View count exsit in the Domino REST API cache folder.

agentcount.description: Agent count exsit in the Domino REST API cache folder.

librarycount.description: Library count exsit in the Domino REST API cache folder.

replicaid.description: A 16-character combination of letters and numbers that represents the replica ID of a Notes database.

name.description: Name of the agent, matches design

alias.description: Collection of alternate names, might match aliases of the Domino design

unid.description: Primary key to find the agent

DesignAgentSimple.title: Root Type for DesignAgentSimple
DesignAgentSimple.description: Definition design information for specific design element Agent.

@documentset.description:
Represents a specified set of target documents that are manipulated by an agent.

The following types run an agent on:

all - All the documents in the database.

allinview - All documents in a view.

modified - All new and modified documents.

runonce - The current document once.

selected - Only the selected documents.

unreadinview - All unread documents in a view.

none

@unid.description: The Note UNID of the agent.

@validForKeep.description: If this agent has been configured to use in Domino REST API.

@noteid.description: The note ID of the agent, which is uniquely identifies a document within a particular database.

@type.description: Indicates the type of the agent (simple action, formula, LotusScript, imported Java, or Java).

DesignColumnSimple.description: This is one Datatype used to compose other schemas, DesignViewSimple and DesignViewSimpleRequest

DesignFieldSimple.description: This is one Datatype used to compose other schemas, DesignFormSimple, DesignFormSimpleRequest and DesignSubFormSimple

DesignFormSimple.description: Definition design information for specific design element Form.

@conflictaction.description: Indicates how to handle form replication conflicts.

@noteid.description: The note ID of a document, which is uniquely identifies a document within a particular database.

@unid.description: Universal Id of the document, uniquely identifies a document across all replicas of a database

@alias.description: Alternate names or alias of the form.

DesignFormSimpleRequest.title: Root Type for DesignFormSimpleRequest
DesignFormSimpleRequest.description: Definition of request to create specific design element Form.

alias.description: Alternate names or alias of the form.

DesignNSFSimple.description: Basic database object. NOTE: This is fit for limited current purpose, not complete for production

templateName.description: programmatic filename of the template, like 'demo.ntf'

nsfPath.description: Path in internet style relative to the Domino data directory

DesignSubFormSimple.title: Root Type for DesignSubFormSimple
DesignSubFormSimple.description: Definition design information for specific design element Form.

@conflictaction.description: Indicates how to handle form replication conflicts.

@noteid.description: The note ID of a document, which is uniquely identifies a document within a particular database.

@unid.description: Universal Id of the document, uniquely identifies a document across all replicas of a database

@alias.description: Alternate names or alias of the form.

DesignViewSimple.description: Definition design information for specific design element View.

@noteid.description: The note ID of a view, which is uniquely identifies a view within a particular database.

@unid.description: Universal Id of the view, uniquely identifies a view across all replicas of a database

@alias.description: Alternate names or alias of the view.

DesignViewSimpleRequest.title: Root Type for DesignViewSimpleRequest
DesignViewSimpleRequest.description: Definition of request to create specific design element View.

selectionFormula.description: The formula to select documents for a view.

ErrorMessage.title: Root Type for ErrorMessage
ErrorMessage.description: Detailed error message, might contain stacktrace

KeepAccess.title: Root Type for KeepAccess
KeepAccess.description:
Provides information of access level required for Domino REST API operations:
- Domino REST API mapping in Domino directory
- Domino REST API configuration in individual databases

Masks ACL and Role checks for users of the API

CreateDbMapping.description: Can the current user create Domino REST API configuration mappings

DeleteDbMapping.description: Can the current user delete Domino REST API configuration mappings

databases.description: Details of access to a given database

KeepAccessDetail.title: Root Type for KeepAccessDetail
KeepAccessDetail.description: Information about access to an individual database and, if access is sufficient, information about available configurations

path.description: Path relativ to the data directory of an NSF

readKeepConfig.description: Can the given user read existing Domino REST API configurations

createDeleteKeepConfig.description: Can the current user create or delete Domino REST API configurations

configurations.description: List of Domino REST API configurations, ready to be mapped, in the design of a database

activeConfigurations.description: Map of confgurations in use. Key is the public name, value the NSF internal name

configurations.name: default2
configurations.description: Get approvals for training, travel and gear

KeepAccessQuery.title: Root Type for KeepAccessQuery
KeepAccessQuery.description: Query to be send to check if user can read/update/delete Domino REST API configurations

databases.description: List of file path to enquiry

checkAllNsf.description: Should the query check all databases on the current server - might take a while. Excludes mail files

onlyConfigured.description: Should only databases with existing Domino REST API configurations be returned

KeepAccessShort.title: Root Type for KeepAccessShort
KeepAccessShort.description:
Provides simple information of access level required for Domino REST API access get operations:
- Domino REST API mapping in Domino directory
- Domino REST API configuration in individual databases

Masks ACL and Role checks for users of the API

CreateDbMapping.description: Can the current user create Domino REST API configuration mappings

DeleteDbMapping.description: Can the current user delete Domino REST API configuration mappings

KeepDatabase.title: Root Type for KeepDatabase
KeepDatabase.description: REST API Configuration of a domino database including views, forms, agents, modes. Used only for admin endpoints.

apiName.description: How this database is known to the API

description.description: Description with human readable details of the database's purpose

formulaEngine.description:
Script engine to be used to resolve permission formulas in FormModes or DQL access.
Native Domino, OpenFormula or JavaScript

Currently only Native Domino is implemented

icon.description: Base64 of an icon. SVG preferred

isActive.description: Allows to enable/disable API access without removing cofiguration. This is used for scope. active is used for schema.

agents.description: List of agents that are permitted to be called from the API

allowCode.description: Can JS code be submitted for execution

configuredForms.description: All forms that are configured for access via the Domino REST API. Details in keepdatabaseconfig_formmode

dqlAccess.description: Does the API allow DQL queries to be submitted? DQL can query any document. Handle with care

forms.description: Array with form configurations including form modes

openAccess.description: Can this database be accessed from a browser e.g. in a React app) or app without providing AppId and AppSecret. Still proper authentication using a JWT bearer is required

dqlFormula.description:
Formula to execute when DQL Access is permitted to determine if it is permitted for the current user.
Domino or OpenFormula

formAliases.description: Collection of key / value pairs to map primary form names to potential alias values. A Notes document created with a form containing the alias will have the last alias value in its Form field

requireRevisionToUpdate.description: If db config "requireRevisionToUpdate" is enabled, then revision is required when update document and only update document when revision version is right.

views.description: Array of Views that are available in the Domino REST API

schemaName.description: name (without .json extension) of schema file in nsf REST file resources

cacheTimestamp.description: timestamp for when design data were last added

@unid.description: Universal Id of the document to be acted upon

availableViews.description: Array of Views that are available in the Domino REST API

prohibitRefresh.description: indicates if the schema is protected against refresh by the design tast

KeepField.title: Root Type for KeepField
KeepField.description:
Field description for fields / items in a KeepFormMode.
Describes name, type, and multi-value capability.
Modeled after json-schema where multi-value = array
extension to json-schema limited to x-access-name
to specify Domino Names, Reader, Author nature
All other field copied from JSON Schema

name.description: Field name. While anything theoretical is possible we stick to letters and numbers with the first letter capitalized. Not a hard rule to accomodate existing data

type.description:
Data type, from JSON spec. Can be:
- object
- array
- string
- number
- integer
- boolean

multivalue.description:
Can the field process multiple values, HCL Domino style.
When missing => false

fieldGroup.description: Domino multi-value fields can be grouped together to form a kind oc child record in a document. The fieldGroup defines such a grouping. It only is relevant for multi-value fields and isn't populated by default

description.description: Long text explanation what the field is about
description.example: Enter the following information yada yada yada

format.description: Format definition for Strings, extended from json-schema with readers, authors, names, json

items.description: Item description can contain type and format

minitems.description: for array type: minimum number of items

fieldAccess.description: Determines the access to a field as Read/Write, ReadOnly or WriteOnly

KeepFieldGroup.title: Root Type for KeepFieldGroup
KeepFieldGroup.description: A KeepFieldGroup describes the properites of a group of multi-value Notes items that form "child records" inside a single Notes document. Besides multi-value items, items with a common name and a counting suffix can form a field group

name.description: Name tha links this definition to fieldGroup entries in KeepFields

type.description: How is the group formed: by multi-value or common field name with counting suffix

suffix.description: Separation character(s) between item name and counter

firstWithoutSuffix.description: For name linked items, does the first have the suffix (Name_1) or not (Name)

max.description: MAximum number of rows/item names to use

KeepForm.description: Definition of a Domino REST API form including form modes

formName.description: Name of the form as stored in the document, might be an alias

fieldGroups.description: Definition of fieldgroups that form detail records inside a document

formModes.description: Array of FormModes configured for this database. Might be empty

alias.description: Alternate names or alias of the form.

KeepFormMode.title: Root Type for KeepFormMode
KeepFormMode.description: Form modes for Domino REST API Database config

modeName.description: lowercase, name of the mode. Special names are default and odata

onLoad.description: Formula to run after loading a document, before returning to the caller

onSave.description: Formula to run after receiving a document, before save

readAccessFormula.description: Formula to determine read access for this mode

required.description: List of fields that are required to be provided

readAccessFields.description: read access fields in this mode

writeAccessFields.description: write access fields in this mode

KeepFormula.title: Root Type for KeepFormula
KeepFormula.description: Formula in a scripting environment, that can be used for true/false evaluation or as a pre-load/save execution.

message.description: Optional message to use for fasilure of formula

QuickConfigParam.description: Definition of request to quick config a domino database

scopeName.description: Name that is used in ?datSsource= parameter to access configured resource

nsfPath.description: path relative to Domino data directory to nsf database

schemaName.description: name (without .json extension) of schema file in nsf REST file resources. Default value is "default"

create.description: If nsf file not exist, create one empty database or not.

icon.description: Base64 of an icon. SVG preferred

maximumAccessLevel.description:
Determines the maximum ACL Level for the scope definition.
Default if not provided is Editor

RestConfigShort.title: Root Type for RestConfigShort
RestConfigShort.description: Short summary of a rest configuration

apiName.description: How this database is known to the API

comment.description: The comment assigned to the design element

template.description: The name of the note-specific template this design element is set to derive from

prohibitRefresh.description: When notes database has been configured "Inherit from the design template", if "Prohibit design refresh or replace to modify" is checked, the design element will not be affected when you replace or refresh the design.

OAuthApplicationRequest.title: Root Type for OAuthApplicationRequest
OAuthApplicationRequest.description: Meta data to register an application for OAuth IdP

redirect_uris.description: List of callback URLs after consent is given. Must use https with the exception of http://localhost/some_url

scope.description: Scopes the application can (and will) request. When the application requests other scopes, token is denied

client_uri.description: Start page of application. Can be used to create list of apps

contacts.description: URL, eMail, handles to contact people responsible for the app

client_id.description: Application ID. Empty on creation, required for update

OAuthApplicationRequestUpdate.title: Root Type for OAuthApplicationRequestUpdate
OAuthApplicationRequestUpdate.description: Meta data to register an application for updating OAuth IdP

redirect_uris.description: List of callback URLs after consent is given. Must use https with the exception of http://localhost/some_url

scope.description: Scopes the application can (and will) request. When the application requests other scopes, token is denied

client_uri.description: Start page of application. Can be used to create list of apps

contacts.description: URL, eMail, handles to contact people responsible for the app

client_id.description: Internal application id. Ignored here, taken from URL query parameter

OAuthApplicationResponse.title: Root Type for OAuthApplicationResponse
OAuthApplicationResponse.description: Response for registering an application for OAuth IdP

client_id.description: System generated client Id. Used for auth request and as user name for Token requests

redirect_uris.description: List of callback URLs after consent is given. Must use https with the exception of http://localhost/some_url

scope.description: Scopes the application can (and will) request. When the application requests other scopes, token is denied

client_uri.description: Start page of application. Can be used to create list of apps

contacts.description: URL, eMail, handles to contact people responsible for the app

@author.description: The person who created the external application

hasSecret.description: Flag to indicate if an application has a secret configured

OAuthApplicationSecretRequest.title: Root Type for OAuthApplicationSecretRequest
OAuthApplicationSecretRequest.description: Meta data to generated secret for an application.

status.description: Whether the application is active or disabled.

client_id.description: Parameter to prevent error for apps that call this API. Value of this gets ignored internally. Use the path parameter for passing client_id.

OAuthApplicationSecretResponse.title: Root Type for OAuthApplicationSecretResponse
OAuthApplicationSecretResponse.description: Response for a client_secret request. Client seccret is returned once

client_id.description: application ID, required as header for access

client_secret.description: The application secret generated by Domino REST API for the external application

name.description: Name of the view, matches design

alias.description: Collection of alternate names, might match aliases of the Domino design

unid.description: Primary key to find the view

Unid.description: 32 char universalId A-Z0-9, primary key unique across replicas

details.description: Json Object containing further details, if appropriate

RestMapping.title: Root Type for RestMapping
RestMapping.description: Maps a rest config from its internal name to the name it is visible. Info can be seen in the Internet sites of the domino directory. Also known as scope

apiName.description: Name that is used in ?datSsource= parameter to access mapped resource

isActive.description: Allows to enable/disable API access without removing cofiguration

@Revisions.description: This field records the current revision version of document. It's a 32-character hex-encoded string of date.

@UpdatedBy.description: The user who update the doc.

schemaName.description: name (without .json extension) of schema file in nsf REST file resources

nsfPath.description: path relative to Domino data directory to nsf database

createSchema.description: Default to be false if you don't set this property. It won't create the schema. When set to be true, it will create schema using given schemaName.

server.description: Domino server name that this scope is enabled on. Empty or '*' mean that this scope is enabled on all Domino servers.

maximumAccessLevel.description:
Limits, but not extends the access level granted to an API user.
Mirrors the MaximumInternetAccess in DB ACLs.
Default if not provided is Editor

RestMappingRequest.title: Root Type for RestMappingRequest
RestMappingRequest.description:
Definition for meta data information to create scope.
Property 'createSchema' should be 'true' if you want to create schema with schemaName.

apiName.description: Name that is used in ?datSsource= parameter to access mapped resource

schemaName.description: name (without .json extension) of schema file in nsf REST file resources

nsfPath.description: path relative to Domino data directory to nsf database

isActive.description: Allows to enable/disable API access without removing cofiguration

createSchema.description: Default to be false if you don't set this property. It won't create the schema. When set to be true, it will create schema using given schemaName.

icon.description: Base64 of an icon. SVG preferred

server.description: Domino server name that this scope is enabled on. Empty or '*' mean that this scope is enabled on all Domino servers.

maximumAccessLevel.description:
Limits, but not extends the access level granted to an API user.
Mirrors the MaximumInternetAccess in DB ACLs.
Default if not provided is Editor

KeepAccessSchema.title: Root Type for KeepAccessSchema
KeepAccessSchema.description: Short description of a schema stored in the resources of a NSF database

description.description: Human readable description of a schema

iconName.description: Name of the assigned svg icon from the list of available icons

400BadRequest.description:
Invalid request. Shows up when submission is flaky:
- Wrong authentication
- Wrong content-type
- Missing or wrong parameter types

value.message: Nice try chap, ask before next time
This is not the data you seek!

value.details: The haferlup needs left turning shrufti
value.message: This is not a supported operation. Try again

406NotAcceptable.description: Invalid operation - something got requested that isn't supported

501NotImplemented.description: Working on it, just not yet

jwt.description: OICD access token or compliant JWT

tags.name: admin
tags.description: The endpoints allow to manage scopes (the Domino databases exposed), OAuth application registration and the general setup of Domino REST API. Accessing these endpoints requires a [KEEPAdmin] role for the user

tags.name: schema
tags.description: Data definitions how the API returns and accepts data, creating independence from Domino design elements. Creating or altering a schema requires designer access to the respective database

tags.name: design
tags.description: Domino design elements including internal Source Code
